parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The small brake pedal surface area can increase the risk of accidents due to the driver's inability to quickly and accurately apply the brakes, especially in panic situations.
symptoms: Difficulty applying brakes
brake pedal feels small
increased stopping distance.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake line can cause the brake pedal to go to the floor, leading to loss of braking power and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: Brake pedal goes to the floor
brake pedal feels soft or spongy
loss of braking power.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) can cause the brakes to lock up, leading to loss of control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: ABS warning light illuminates
brakes lock up
extended stopping distance
vehicle pulls to one side.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Premature wear of brake rotors and pads can lead to reduced braking power and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: Excessive wear of front brake rotors and pads
frequent replacement of brake rotors and pads.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Issues with the brake pedal, such as a hard or soft pedal, can cause the driver to lose control of the vehicle, leading to accidents.
symptoms: Brake pedal feels hard or soft
brake pedal goes to the floor
loss of braking power.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power brake system can cause the brakes to fail, leading to loss of control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: No power brakes
brake pedal feels hard or soft
loss of braking power.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Intermittent brake failure can cause the driver to lose control of the vehicle, leading to accidents.
symptoms: Intermittent loss of braking power
brake pedal feels hard or soft
extended stopping distance.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent failure of the windshield wipers can cause poor visibility while driving, especially in inclement weather conditions, which can lead to accidents or near-miss situations.
symptoms: The windshield wipers stop working suddenly
the windshield wipers work intermittently
the windshield wipers do not come on immediately when turned on
the windshield wipers have a delayed reaction when the switch is turned on
the windshield wipers stop working after driving over a bump
the windshield wipers need to be tapped or moved to start working again.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the torsion bar can cause the vehicle's suspension to collapse, leading to loss of control, accidents, and potentially fatal consequences.
symptoms: The vehicle's front end drops down
the vehicle leans to one side
the suspension collapses
and the vehicle becomes difficult or impossible to steer.
